  • Facet

Coveo component Facet

This component displays a facet of the results for the current query. A facet consists of a list of values for a given field occurring in the results, ordered using a configurable criteria.
The list of values is obtained using a IGroupByRequest operation performed at the same time as the main query.
The Facet component allows the user to drill down inside results by restricting to certain field values. It also allows filtering out values, and can provide a search box to look for specific values inside larger sets.
It is probably the most complex component in the Coveo UI, and as such allows many different options.

Component Options

additionalFilter

additionalFilter: string
  • Defined in src/ui/Facet/Facet.ts :358

Specifies an additional query expression (query override) to add to each group by that this facet performs.
See : IGroupByRequest.
Example : @date>=2014/01/01

allowedValues

allowedValues: Array<string>
  • Defined in src/ui/Facet/Facet.ts :352

Specifies an explicit list of allowedValues in the IGroupByRequest.
This will whitelist the facet content to some specific values.
Example ["File", "People"].

availableSorts

availableSorts: Array<string>
  • Defined in src/ui/Facet/Facet.ts :171

Specifies the sort criteria options you want to be displayed in the facet settings menu.
Of course Facet.options.enableSettings needs to be true.
Possible values are : occurrences, score, alphaAscending, alphaDescending, computedfieldascending, computedfielddescending, custom The default value is occurrences,score,alphaAscending,alphaDescending.

computedField

computedField: string
  • Defined in src/ui/Facet/Facet.ts :278

Specifies the name of a field on which an aggregate operation should be executed for all distinct values of the facet's field.
The result of the operation is displayed along with the number of occurrences for each value.
You can use this option to compute the sum of a field (like a money amount) for each facet value that is listed.
Works in conjunction with Facet.options.computedFieldOperation , Facet.options.computedFieldFormat, Facet.options.computedFieldCaption

computedFieldCaption

computedFieldCaption: string
  • Defined in src/ui/Facet/Facet.ts :308

Specifies what will be the caption of the Facet.options.computedField in the settings menu for sort.
For example, the value Money will be displayed as Money Ascending for computed field ascending.
The default value is Computed Field.

computedFieldFormat

computedFieldFormat: string
  • Defined in src/ui/Facet/Facet.ts :302

Specifies how to format the values resulting from a Facet.options.computedFieldOperation.
The formats available are defined by the Globalize library. The most common used formats are:

  • c0 - Formats the value as a currency.
  • n0 - Formats the value as an integer.
  • n2 - Formats the value as a floating point with 2 decimal digits.
See : Globalize for more informations.
Default value is 'c0

computedFieldOperation

computedFieldOperation: string
  • Defined in src/ui/Facet/Facet.ts :290

Specifies the type of aggregate operation to use on the Facet.options.computedField.
The available values are:

  • sum - Computes the sum of the computed field values.
  • average - Computes the average of the computed field values.
  • minimum - Finds the minimum value of the computed field values.
  • maximum - Finds the maximum value of the computed field values.

The default value is sum.

customSort

customSort: Array<string>
  • Defined in src/ui/Facet/Facet.ts :186

Specifies a custom order by which facet values are sorted.
For example, you could use this to specify a logical order for support tickets -> customSort : ["New","Opened","Feedback","Resolved","Feedback"].

dependsOn

dependsOn: string
  • Defined in src/ui/Facet/Facet.ts :364

Specifies that the facet appears only when a value is selected in its "parent" facet.
To specify the parent facet, use it's Facet.options.id. Remember that be default, the id of a facet is it's Facet.options.field.
Example -> dependsOn : @parentfacetField

enableCollapse

enableCollapse: boolean
  • Defined in src/ui/Facet/Facet.ts :346

Specifies if the facet is collapsible.
The default value is true.

enableFacetSearch

enableFacetSearch: boolean
  • Defined in src/ui/Facet/Facet.ts :218

Specifies whether the search box for searching inside the available values will be displayed at the bottom of the facet.
The default value is true.

enableMoreLess

enableMoreLess: boolean
  • Defined in src/ui/Facet/Facet.ts :336

Specifies if the more/less button is enabled.
The default value is true.

enableResponsiveMode

enableResponsiveMode: boolean
  • Defined in src/ui/Facet/Facet.ts :399

Specifies if the responsive mode should be enabled on the facets. Responsive mode will make the facet dissapear and instead be availaible using a dropdown button. Responsive facets are enabled when the width of the element the search interface is bound to reaches 800 pixels. This value can be modified using Facet.options.responsiveBreakpoint.

Disabling reponsive mode for one facet will disable it for all facets. Therefore, this options only needs to be set on one facet to be effective. The default value is true.

enableSettings

enableSettings: boolean
  • Defined in src/ui/Facet/Facet.ts :158

Specifies whether to show the facet settings menu.
The default value is true.

enableSettingsFacetState

enableSettingsFacetState: boolean
  • Defined in src/ui/Facet/Facet.ts :164

Specifies if the save state menu option is available on the facet setting menu.
Of course Facet.options.enableSettings needs to be true.
Default value is false

enableTogglingOperator

enableTogglingOperator: boolean
  • Defined in src/ui/Facet/Facet.ts :213

Specifies whether the user is allowed to toggle between OR and AND mode, using an icon in the top right corner of the facet.
The default value is false.

facetSearchDelay

facetSearchDelay: number
  • Defined in src/ui/Facet/Facet.ts :224

Specifies the delay (in milliseconds) before a search is sent to the server when the user starts typing in the facet search box.
Using a smaller value means that results will arrive faster, but it increases the chances that many of the requests sent to the server get cancelled as the user continues typing in characters.
Default is 100

facetSearchIgnoreAccents

facetSearchIgnoreAccents: boolean
  • Defined in src/ui/Facet/Facet.ts :229

Specifies if the accents are ignored in the facet search.
The default value is false

field

field: string
  • Defined in src/ui/Facet/Facet.ts :129

Specifies the index field whose values will be use in the facet.
This require the given field to be configured correctly in the index as a facet field.
This is a required option and cannot be omitted, otherwise the facet component will not work.

headerIcon

headerIcon: string
  • Defined in src/ui/Facet/Facet.ts :134
deprecated

This option is exposed for legacy reason, and the recommendation is to not use this option.

Specifies the css class to change the facet header icon.

id

id: string
  • Defined in src/ui/Facet/Facet.ts :141

Specifies a unique identifier for a facet. This identifier will be used to save the facet state in the url hash, for example.
Optional, since the default will be the Facet.options.field option.
If you have two facets with the same field on the same page, you should specify an id for at least one of those two facets.
That id need to be unique on the page.

includeInBreadcrumb

includeInBreadcrumb: boolean
  • Defined in src/ui/Facet/Facet.ts :239

Specifies if the facet should push data to the Breadcrumb.
The default value is true

includeInOmnibox

includeInOmnibox: boolean
  • Defined in src/ui/Facet/Facet.ts :255
deprecated

This option is exposed for legacy reason, and the recommendation is to not use this option.

Specifies if the facet should push data to the Omnibox.
It can have a real negative impact on index performance.
The default value is false.

injectionDepth

injectionDepth: number
  • Defined in src/ui/Facet/Facet.ts :197

Specifies the injection depth that will be used for the group by operation.
The injection depth determines how many results are scanned in the index to ensure all potential facet values are listed. Increasing this value enhances the accuracy of the listed values, at the cost of performance.
The default value is 1000.

isMultiValueField

isMultiValueField: boolean
  • Defined in src/ui/Facet/Facet.ts :148

Specifies if the field is configured in the index as a multi value field (meaning: comma separated values).
Default value is false

lookupField

lookupField: string
  • Defined in src/ui/Facet/Facet.ts :153
deprecated

This option is exposed for legacy reason, and the recommendation is to not use this option.

Specifies the field whose values will be displayed in the facet.

numberOfValues

numberOfValues: number
  • Defined in src/ui/Facet/Facet.ts :191

Specifies the maximum number of field values that will be displayed by default in the facet, before the user click on "More".
The default value is 5.

numberOfValuesInBreadcrumb

numberOfValuesInBreadcrumb: number
  • Defined in src/ui/Facet/Facet.ts :244

Specifies the maximum number of values that the facet should display in the Breadcrumb, before outputting a "See more" button.
Default is 5 on desktop, 3 on mobile

numberOfValuesInFacetSearch

numberOfValuesInFacetSearch: number
  • Defined in src/ui/Facet/Facet.ts :234

Specifies the number of values displayed in the facet search results popup.
The default value is 15.

numberOfValuesInOmnibox

numberOfValuesInOmnibox: number
  • Defined in src/ui/Facet/Facet.ts :266
deprecated

This option is exposed for legacy reason, and the recommendation is to not use this option.

Specifies the number of values to populate the Breadcrumb with.
Of course, the Facet.options.includeInOmnibox option needs to be "true".
It can have a real negative impact on index performance.
The default value is 5 on desktop, 3 on mobile.

paddingContainer

paddingContainer: HTMLElement
  • Defined in src/ui/Facet/Facet.ts :326

Specifies the parent container of the facets.
Used for the Facet.options.preservePosition.
The default value is element.parentElement.

pageSize

pageSize: number
  • Defined in src/ui/Facet/Facet.ts :341

Specifies the number of additional results to fetch when clicking on "More" in the facet search.
The default value is 10.

preservePosition

preservePosition: boolean
  • Defined in src/ui/Facet/Facet.ts :320

Specifies whether the facet should remain stable in its current position in the viewport while the mouse is over it.
Whenever values are selected in a facet, a new query is automatically performed. This new query might cause other elements in the page to be resized (typically other facets above the one being used).
When this option is enabled, the facet will adjust the scroll amount of the page to ensure that it does not move relative to the mouse when the results are updated.
In some cases, the facet will also add margin to the scrollContainer, if scrolling alone is not enough to preserve position.
This is the option that will add a div 'coveo-topSpace' / 'coveo-bottomSpace` around the facet container. The default value is true.

responsiveBreakpoint

responsiveBreakpoint: number
  • Defined in src/ui/Facet/Facet.ts :406

Specifies the width of the search interface, in pixels, at which the facets will go into responsive mode. The responsive mode will be triggered when the width is equal or below this value. The search interface corresponds to the element with the class CoveoSearchInterface. The default value is 800.

scrollContainer

scrollContainer: HTMLElement
  • Defined in src/ui/Facet/Facet.ts :331

Specifies the HTML element (through a CSS selector) whose scroll amount the facet should adjust to preserve its position Facet.options.preservePosition when results are updated.
The default value is document.body.

showIcon

showIcon: boolean
  • Defined in src/ui/Facet/Facet.ts :203
deprecated

This option is exposed for legacy reason, and the recommendation is to not use this option.

Specifies whether an icon is displayed next to each facet value.
The default value is false.

sortCriteria

sortCriteria: string
  • Defined in src/ui/Facet/Facet.ts :181

Specifies the criteria used to sort facet values.
See IGroupByRequest for the list of available values.
The default value is the first value of Facet.options.availableSorts list, or 'occurrences' if there's none specified.

title

title: string
  • Defined in src/ui/Facet/Facet.ts :119

Specifies the title displayed at the top of the facet.
Default is the localized string for "No Title"

useAnd

useAnd: boolean
  • Defined in src/ui/Facet/Facet.ts :208

Specifies whether the filter generated when multiple values are selected uses the AND operator, meaning that only documents having all selected values matches the resulting query.
By default filters are using the OR operator, and the resulting query matches all documents with at least one of the selected values.

valueCaption

valueCaption: IStringMap<string>
  • Defined in src/ui/Facet/Facet.ts :387

Specifies a JSON object describing a mapping of facet values to desired captions.

This option can only be set in the init call of your search interface, not directly as an HTML attribute.

// Example: Using a facet for file types
var myValueCaption = {  "txt": "Text files","html": "Web page", [ etc ... ]};

Coveo.init(document.querySelector('#search'), {
   Facet : {
     valueCaption: myValueCaption
   }
})
// Or using the jquery extension
$("#search").coveo("init", {
   Facet: {
     valueCaption: myValueCaption
   }
})

Static get

  • get(element: HTMLElement, componentClass?: any, noThrow?: boolean): BaseComponent

  • Inherited from Component.get

    • Defined in src/ui/Base/Component.ts :176

    Get the bound component to the given HTMLElement. Throws an assert if the HTMLElement has no component bound, unless using the noThrow argument
    If there is multiple component bound to the current HTMLElement, you must specify the component class

    Parameters

    • element: HTMLElement

      HTMLElement for which to get the bound component

    • Optional componentClass: any

      Optional component class. If the HTMLElement has multiple components bound, you must specify which one you are targeting

    • Optional noThrow: boolean

      Boolean option to tell the method to not throw on error

    Returns BaseComponent

Constructors

constructor

  • new Facet(element: HTMLElement, options: IFacetOptions, bindings?: IComponentBindings, facetClassId?: string): Facet

  • Overwrites Component.constructor

    • Defined in src/ui/Facet/Facet.ts :450

    Create a new Facet component, bind multiple query events as well

    Parameters

    • element: HTMLElement
    • options: IFacetOptions
    • Optional bindings: IComponentBindings
    • Default value facetClassId: string = Facet.ID

      The id to use for this facet (as Facet inherited from by other component (eg : FacetRange). Default is "Facet"

    Returns Facet
